work.name: Nebullam
work.description: Nebullam Inc., a Y-Combinator backed startup, specializes in direct-to-consumer indoor farming and offers unique produce subscriptions and fresh salads via drive-thru restaurants.
work.summary: As Lead Software Engineer at Nebullam, I oversee the development and maintenance of software and hardware systems, collaborating with the CEO and CTO on technical strategy.
highlights: Developed and deployed a computer vision application on a Nvidia Jetson, enabling data collection and analytics.
Implemented a Slack bot using LangChain and OpenAI APIs for team engagement and adaptability to Large Language Models (LLMs), fostering a collaborative and tech-savvy work environment.
Developed a Shopify store for subscription produce, generating $250,000 in first-year revenue and expanding our direct-to-consumer market.
Rapidly designed and deployed a tech stack for drive-thru restaurants, including IoT and POS systems, yielding $650,000 projected first-year revenue and immediate profitability.

work.name: Principal Financial Group
work.description: Principal Financial Group is an American global financial investment management and insurance company headquartered in Des Moines, Iowa, U.S.
highlights: Played a key role in the IT Recruitment Committee, strategizing to attract and develop a pipeline of over 100 top-tier IT interns annually.
Collaborated in designing and automating web infrastructure, enhancing system efficiency across various products and services.

work.name: Midest Beer Club
work.description: Direct to consumer craft beer service.
highlights: Secured $12,000 in startup funding through Cystarters, demonstrating persuasive pitch skills and strategic planning, essential for launching our business concept.
Efficiently developed and launched a user-friendly beer subscription website within a 12-week program, demonstrating rapid project execution and technical expertise.
Established partnerships with over 8 Iowa craft breweries, leveraging strong relationship-building and negotiation skills for successful business collaboration.

volunteer.summary: As a mentor and judge at Kreative Horizon Hackathons, I provided guidance to participants in developing their technical skills and played a role in selecting and rewarding the most innovative and effective solutions.

volunteer.organization: Iowa State University Pappajohn Center for Entrepreneurship
volunteer.summary: At Iowa State University's Pitch Competitions, I combine my roles as a mentor and judge, offering valuable insights to participants to refine their pitches and playing a pivotal part in selecting the most promising and innovative technology projects.
